conclusion: Determine the temperature at state C using pressure, volume, and internal energy-temperature relationship.
Identify initial conditions at state A: Pressure \( p_A = p_0 \), Volume \( V_A = V_0 \), Temperature \( T_A = T_0 \).
Use ideal gas law to find number of moles \( n \): \( n = \frac{p_0 V_0}{R T_0} \).
Identify conditions at state C: Pressure \( p_C = 0.6 p_0 \), Volume \( V_C = 0.5 V_0 \), Temperature \( T_C \).
Use ideal gas law at state C: \( 0.3 p_0 V_0 = n R T_C \).
Substitute value of \( n \) into equation: \( 0.3 p_0 V_0 = \frac{p_0 V_0 T_C}{T_0} \).
Final Answer: Temperature at state C is \( \boxed{0.3 T_0} \).
